content.description: Nice problem with plenty of decent holds. Slab so just keep moving your feet.Start feet on and hands as low as possible.
content.location: Furthest left problem. Walk right of the road past the first wall and keep walking. If you hit the overhang wall you went too far

content.description: Great problem and still a little slabby. Less hold options than the left problems. I really enjoyed the last part
content.protection: 2 pads. 1 to level out the other.
content.location: You should see obvious starting crimps right of the large undercling that starts Bandit Lookout. From there go straight up

content.description: Another great slab problem with a bit more difficulty then the left problem.
content.location: Start on the large undercling. Follow the crack line

pathTokens: EM: Sage Mountain Recreation Area Missouri

content.description: This side offers more sandstone walls with a unique niche and some obvious soft areas. With that said, the rest of the wall is quality sandstone.
